725649f-a.title: Queens: 78th Street - 32nd Avenue
725649f-a.text:
78th Street, west side, 150 feet south of 32nd Avenue,
showing the headquarters of the famous ''Blaok Watch'' during the
Revolution. It was built more than 200 years ago and during the
campaign on Long Island command'ng officers of the 42nd High-
landers, it was said, lived in this farmhouse. These views
show the original location on Trains Meadow Road, an ancient
2igzagging country road, later obliterated. Views 1 and 2 are
in a northerly direction; views 3 and 4, in a southerly. In
the latter the house is in the center background. See the
''New York Herald.Tribune,'' March 8, 1936.
1923
Views 1,2,3,4
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED

725648f-a.title: Queens: 78th Street - 32nd Avenue
725648f-a.text:
78th Street, west side, 150 feet south of 32nd Avenue,
showing the headquarters of the famous ''Black Watch'' during
the War for Independence. It was built more than two centuries
ago and during the campaign on Long lIsland commanding officers
of the 42nd Highlanders, it was said, lived here. These views
show the original location on Trains Meadow Road, an ancient
country road, later obliterated. Eugene L. Armbruster refers
to the house as the W. Wright farmhouse and also as the Walker
farmhouse. See the ''New York Herald-Tribune,'' March 8, 1936.
1925
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODCED

725650f-c.title: Queens: 78th Street - 32nd Avenue
725650f-c.text:
78th Street, west side, just south of Thirty-second Avenue,
showing the Wsight farmhouse from 1860-1873. See other views for
more data.
October,1925.
Views 1 and 2 31 3
Eugene M. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

725213f-a.title: Queens: 32nd Avenue - 78th Street
725213f-a.text:
At the S.E. corner of Thirty-second Avene, and 78th Streets,
showing an old home in the street line owned by W. Locke in 1873
and H. Nonken in 1896.
April 1923.
Nugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE RECRODUCED.

725651f-a.title: Queens: 78th Street - 32nd Street
725651f-a.text:
78th Street, west side, just south of Thirty-second Avenue,
78th Street is to the right of Trains Meadow Road(now 1935 non-
existent) showing in a set of 4 views the Wright farmhouse. Views
2,3 and 4, show a closer view of the house.
March 1923
View 21 Oct. 1, 1925
View 31 May 1927
View 4 April 1923
Nugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

725652f-a.title: Queens: 78th Street - 32nd Avenue
725652f-a.text:
78th Street, west side, just south of 32nd Avenue, showing
the Wright farmhouse, dating back to pre-Revolutionary days.
It was formerly on Trains Meadow Road, now no longer in exist-
ence. See other views for additional data.
P. L. Sperr  October 21, 1935
Nr REgPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2
